This due to partisan gerrymandering. And for those new to the topic of gerrymandering, the
definition of gerrymandering is to "divide (a
territorial unit) into election districts to give one political party an electoral majority in a large number of districts while
concentrating the voting strength of the opposition in as few districts as possible."
Long story short what it ends up doing is it fucks with the proper representation
of a state. When you look at how some of the districts were carved up to favor Republicans

district map was
unconstitutional. That decision stating that the map clearly plainly and palpably violates the Constitution the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
The ruling gave lawmakers until February 9th to create a new district map saying if they do not by then the court welcomed all
parties and intervenors to submit maps. After this we saw members of the state GOP enter an emergency appeal with the Supreme Court, the
Court rejected that request, and though the court didn't explicitly state
